meanings.definition: Happening by good luck or favorable circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The team's victory was fortunately due to their hard work paying off.
meanings.sent2: She found a fortunately placed parking spot right in front of the store.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fortunately timed jump made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rainbow appeared fortunately after the storm, bringing hope.
meanings.sent5: The rescue team arrived fortunately just in time to save the stranded hikers.

meanings.sent1: Fortunately, the rain stopped just before the outdoor wedding ceremony.
meanings.sent2: He forgot his umbrella, but fortunately, his friend had an extra one.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick failed, but fortunately, the audience thought it was part of the act.
meanings.sent4: The lost dog was fortunately found by a kind stranger in the park.
meanings.sent5: Fortunately, the train was delayed, giving her just enough time to catch it.
